page.title: 06CHOSEN HILL RESERVOIR
page.content: The reservoir is split into 5 parts,4 being at the top of the hill and one lower down.The last reservoir was built in 1967 and was the largest, holding 32 megalitres.The overall capacity is 71 megalitres of water. The area served is Gloucester City,and there is a feedback to South Western areas of Cheltenham. Each reservoir has turved banks to merge with the landscape,and the vent pipes have been designed to be unobtrusive.The works buildings are of Cotswold stone with mullioned windows, and tiling in keeping with the style of the area. Within the grounds is a warning beacon for aeroplanes from Staverton Airport a few miles away.The whole area is surrounded by a seven foot fence to discourage intruders.
